item.title: Block content home1
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [kc_row _id="435821"][kc_column width="50%" _id="16466" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`999`:{`typography`:{`text-align|`:`center`},`box`:{`width|`:`100%`}},`any`:{`box`:{`padding|`:`60px inherit 50px inherit`}}}}"][element_block_heading _id="690199" heading="Health Care Solution" subheading="We Provide"][kc_column_text _id="650297" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`typography`:{`color|`:`#000000`,`font-size|`:`17px`},`box`:{`margin|`:`inherit inherit 20px inherit`}}}}"]Mediac Hospital is a 404-bed comprehensive center for pediatric health care. As one of the largest pediatric medical centers in the United States, Mediac’s offers a complete range of health care services for everyone.[/kc_column_text][kc_column_text _id="72189"]We have approximately 25,000 inpatient admissions each year and our 200+ specialized clinical programs schedule 557,000 visits annually. Last year the hospital performed more than 26,500 surgical procedures and 158,700 radiological examinations.[/kc_column_text][/kc_column][kc_column width="50%" _id="645701" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`999`:{`typography`:{`text-align|`:`center`},`box`:{`width|`:`100%`}}}}"][kc_single_image image_size="full" image_effect_option="yes" image_wrap="yes" image_source="media_library" image="9183" image_effect="effect-default" image_align="left" _id="815917"][/kc_column][/kc_row]

Mediac Hospital is a 404-bed comprehensive center for pediatric health care. As one of the largest pediatric medical centers in the United States, Mediac’s offers a complete range of health care services for everyone.

[/kc_column_text][kc_column_text _id="641570" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`typography`:{`font-size|`:`17px`},`box`:{`margin|`:`20px inherit 20px inherit`}}}}"]

We have approximately 25,000 inpatient admissions each year and our 200+ specialized clinical programs schedule 557,000 visits annually. Last year the hospital performed more than 26,500 surgical procedures and 158,700 radiological examinations.

[/kc_column_text][/kc_column_inner#][/kc_row_inner#][kc_row_inner# column_align="middle" _id="481673"][kc_column_inner# width="12/12" _id="418119"][element_featured_box icon="me-cardiogram" title="Online Appointment" box_style="v2" info="U3RheSBmb2N1c2VkLiBEb250IGV2ZXIgcGxheSB5b3Vyc2VsZi4gRWdnIHdoaXRlcywgdHVya2V5IHNhdXNhZ2UsIHdoZWF0IHRvYXN0LCB3YXRlci4gQmxlc3MgdXAuIFRoZSBrZXkgdG8gc3VjY2VzcyBpcyB0byBrZWVwIHlvdXIgaGVhZCBhYm92ZSB0aGUgd2F0ZXI=" _id="481456"][element_featured_box icon="me-first-aid-kit2" title="Emergency Services" box_style="v2" info="VGhlcmUgYXJlIG1hbnkgdmFyaWF0aW9ucyBvZiBwYXNzYWdlcyBvZiBMb3JlbSBJcHN1bSBhdmFpbGFibGUsIGJ1dCB0aGUgbWFqb3JpdHkgaGF2ZSBzdWZmZXJlZCBhbHRlcmF0aW9uIGluIHNvbWUgZm9ybQ==" _id="770887"][element_featured_box icon="me-assistant" title="Qualified Doctors" box_style="v2" info="QWxsIHRoZSBMb3JlbSBJcHN1bSBnZW5lcmF0b3JzIG9uIHRoZSBJbnRlcm5ldCB0ZW5kIHRvIHJlcGVhdCBwcmVkZWZpbmVkIGNodW5rcyBhcyBuZWNlc3NhcnksIG1ha2luZyB0aGlzIHRoZSBmaXJzdCB0cnVlIGdlbmVyYXRvciBvbiB0aGUgSW50ZXJuZXQ=" _id="729995"][/kc_column_inner#][/kc_row_inner#][/kc_column_inner][/kc_row_inner][/kc_column][/kc_row]

item.title: service detail
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[kc_row use_container="yes" _id="650816"][kc_column width="12/12" _id="479126"][kc_column_text _id="337083"]

At One Medical, we believe that women’s health and primary care go hand-in-hand, and we offer a comprehensive range of services at our Government Center office. By working with your primary care provider, you can avoid unnecessary specialist visits.
Our primary care team can address a variety of women’s health issues, including birth control counseling and prescriptions, pregnancy, sexual health, cancer screening, and aging, while offering the added insight of your complete medical history.
And our lab is available on-site for any tests that you might need, without requiring an additional appointment. If your provider feels that you would benefit from a specialist visit, we’re happy to connect you to the right person.

[/kc_column_text][/kc_column][/kc_row][kc_row use_container="yes" _id="142974" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`box`:{`margin|`:`30px inherit 50px inherit`}}}}"][kc_column width="50%" _id="271255"][kc_box data="" _id="370423"][/kc_column][kc_column width="50%" _id="910546"][kc_single_image image_size="full" image_effect_option="yes" _id="164125" image_source="media_library" image="9484" image_effect="effect-default"][/kc_column][/kc_row][kc_row use_container="yes" _id="808261"][kc_column width="12/12" _id="890440"][kc_column_text _id="73262"]

Critical Care

Our team of experts is prepared to handle the most difficult oncologic emergencies and other complications experienced by cancer patients. Patients can be safely transported to the intensive care unit (ICU) from anywhere in Maryland with our exclusive critical care ambulance system, Maryland ExpressCare.

Staffed with specially trained critical care nurses and paramedics, these vehicles operate round the clock and are outfitted with the most modern critical care transport equipment available. Once admitted to the intensive care service, patients benefit from our integrated, interdisciplinary approach to treating cancer.

Some Health Tips
Our specialty care providers focus on particular areas of care in which they have extensive training and education

Dental Program

Many times cancer patients need special dental care and must be evaluated by physicians specializing in oral care and hygiene. You may be referred to this program by your physician or health care professional for diagnosing and/or treating any oral condition prior to, during, or after your medical care. The dental hygienist can also help you with any oral or dental conditions that may result from your treatment.

The Dental Office is located in the North Hospital on 9West, Room 65, and can be reached at 410-328-5940.

item.title: Individual Basic Membership
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
• Complimentary attendance to 1 event each year
  • Get exclusive early access (30 days earlier) to esearch reports
  • Exclusive post-event access to educational programs via webinar and/or event videos
  • Special mention as patron and supporter in widely-distributed programs and other overviews
  • Unparalleled networking opportunities with CHI leaders, other members, and education leaders

item.title: Individual standard Membership
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
• Discounted member rates to all educational events
  • Get exclusive early access (30 days earlier) to research reports
  • Exclusive post-event access to educational programs via webinar and/or event videos
  • Special mention as patron and supporter in widely-distributed programs and other overviews
  • Unparalleled networking opportunities with leaders, other members, and education leaders

item.title: Individual Executive Membership
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
• Discounted member rates to all educational events
  • Opportunity to serve as a distinguished panelist or speaker at one of leading annual events
  • Get exclusive early access (30 days earlier) to research reports
  • Exclusive post-event access to educational programs via webinar and/or event videos
  • Special annual briefing with experts and thought-leaders on the latest healthcare trends, challenges, and opportunities

item.excerpt:encoded: Booking an international trip and wondering whether you’ll need any special medication or vaccinations? Be sure to check in with One Medical’s travel clinic, located in our Government Center office.

item.excerpt:encoded: Children’s Medical Services (CMS) is a collection of programs that serve children with special health care needs. Each program provides family-centered care using statewide networks of specially qualified doctors, nurses, and other healthcare professionals.

item.title: Cardiology
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[kc_row use_container="yes" _id="268624"][kc_column width="12/12" _id="375561"][kc_column_text _id="341555"] At One Medical, we believe that women’s health and primary care go hand-in-hand, and we offer a comprehensive range of services at our Government Center office. By working with your primary care provider, you can avoid unnecessary specialist visits. Our primary care team can address a variety of women’s health issues, including birth control counseling and prescriptions, pregnancy, sexual health, cancer screening, and aging, while offering the added insight of your complete medical history. And our lab is available on-site for any tests that you might need, without requiring an additional appointment. If your provider feels that you would benefit from a specialist visit, we’re happy to connect you to the right person. [/kc_column_text][/kc_column][/kc_row][kc_row use_container="yes" _id="293452" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`box`:{`margin|`:`30px inherit 50px inherit`}}}}"][kc_column width="50%" _id="191183"][kc_box data="" _id="499457"][/kc_column][kc_column width="50%" _id="523506"][kc_single_image image_size="full" image_effect_option="yes" _id="195755" image_source="media_library" image="9487" image_effect="effect-default"][/kc_column][/kc_row][kc_row use_container="yes" _id="636261"][kc_column width="12/12" _id="151379"][kc_column_text _id="75536"] Critical Care Our team of experts is prepared to handle the most difficult oncologic emergencies and other complications experienced by cancer patients. Patients can be safely transported to the intensive care unit (ICU) from anywhere in Maryland with our exclusive critical care ambulance system, Maryland ExpressCare. Staffed with specially trained critical care nurses and paramedics, these vehicles operate round the clock and are outfitted with the most modern critical care transport equipment available. Once admitted to the intensive care service, patients benefit from our integrated, interdisciplinary approach to treating cancer.
Some Health Tips Our specialty care providers focus on particular areas of care in which they have extensive training and education
Dental Program Many times cancer patients need special dental care and must be evaluated by physicians specializing in oral care and hygiene. You may be referred to this program by your physician or health care professional for diagnosing and/or treating any oral condition prior to, during, or after your medical care. The dental hygienist can also help you with any oral or dental conditions that may result from your treatment. The Dental Office is located in the North Hospital on 9West, Room 65, and can be reached at 410-328-5940. [/kc_column_text][/kc_column][/kc_row][kc_row use_container="yes" _id="792296" item.excerpt:encoded: Our team of medical professionals is here to help you. With expertise in primary care as well as specializations like athletic medicine, sexual health, and more, we can provide you with the range of care you need.

item.excerpt:encoded:
He graduated from the Tshwane University of Technology in Pretoria, South Africa.
He has been fascinated by the area of dentistry from a young age as many family members were involved in the industry and the field of dental technology enabled him to combine his love of biology with his ability to craft and create.

item.excerpt:encoded:
She graduated from the Tshwane University of Technology in Pretoria, South Africa.
She has been fascinated by the area of dentistry from a young age as many family members were involved in the industry and the field of dental technology enabled him to combine his love of biology with his ability to craft and create.

item.title: Problems in Healthcare
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[kc_row use_container="yes" _id="525088"][kc_column width="12/12" _id="913794"][kc_column_text _id="868295"] At One Medical, we believe that women’s health and primary care go hand-in-hand, and we offer a comprehensive range of services at our Government Center office. By working with your primary care provider, you can avoid unnecessary specialist visits. Our primary care team can address a variety of women’s health issues, including birth control counseling and prescriptions, pregnancy, sexual health, cancer screening, and aging, while offering the added insight of your complete medical history. And our lab is available on-site for any tests that you might need, without requiring an additional appointment. If your provider feels that you would benefit from a specialist visit, we’re happy to connect you to the right person. [/kc_column_text][/kc_column][/kc_row][kc_row use_container="yes" _id="845049" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`box`:{`margin|`:`30px inherit 50px inherit`}}}}"][kc_column width="50%" _id="287384"][kc_box data="" _id="186150"][/kc_column][kc_column width="50%" _id="29812"][kc_single_image image_size="full" image_effect_option="yes" _id="641807" image_source="media_library" image="10219" image_effect="effect-default"][/kc_column][/kc_row][kc_row use_container="yes" _id="791718"][kc_column width="12/12" _id="23423"][kc_column_text _id="115280"] Critical Care Our team of experts is prepared to handle the most difficult oncologic emergencies and other complications experienced by cancer patients. Patients can be safely transported to the intensive care unit (ICU) from anywhere in Maryland with our exclusive critical care ambulance system, Maryland ExpressCare. Staffed with specially trained critical care nurses and paramedics, these vehicles operate round the clock and are outfitted with the most modern critical care transport equipment available. Once admitted to the intensive care service, patients benefit from our integrated, interdisciplinary approach to treating cancer.
Some Health Tips Our specialty care providers focus on particular areas of care in which they have extensive training and education
Dental Program Many times cancer patients need special dental care and must be evaluated by physicians specializing in oral care and hygiene. You may be referred to this program by your physician or health care professional for diagnosing and/or treating any oral condition prior to, during, or after your medical care. The dental hygienist can also help you with any oral or dental conditions that may result from your treatment. The Dental Office is located in the North Hospital on 9West, Room 65, and can be reached at 410-328-5940. [/kc_column_text][/kc_column][/kc_row][kc_row use_container="yes" _id="340723" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`title-style`:{`color|+.kc_title,.kc_title,.kc_title a.kc_title_link`:`#000000`,`padding|+.kc_title,.kc_title,.kc_title a.kc_title_link`:`inherit inherit 30px inherit`}}}}"][kc_accordion _id="678938"][kc_accordion_tab title="How is my Medical Services Provider assigned?" _id="882032"][kc_column_text _id="362563"]Your Medical Services Provider is randomly assigned to you when you first enroll at Columbia University. However, you are welcomed to change your health care provider whenever you like simply by informing our front desk staff.[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="How do I make a medical appointment?" _id="354838"][kc_column_text _id="429466"]Use our secure appointment portal, Open CommunicatorOpens in a new window, to make an appointment online[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="What do I need to do to get vaccines?" _id="819022"][kc_column_text _id="712510"] First, know which vaccine(s) you need. Based on this information, you can either be seen directly at John Jay Hall, 4th Floor or make an appointment for an evaluation. To make your appointment, schedule it via Open Communicator and select “vaccinations”. Follow the steps listed to identify if you need a nurse or a physician appointment. You can also call (212) 854-7426 to schedule an appointment or come see us at John Jay Hall, 4th Floor to make an appointment in person. [/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="Do I need an appointment for emergency contraception?" _id="297971"][kc_column_text _id="875342"]Visit Medical Services during hours of operation if you need emergency contraception immediately or schedule a same day appointment with a Medical Services provider. Most emergency contraception must be started within 72 hours.[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][/kc_accordion][/kc_column][/kc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: We offers a full spectrum of neurological care and rehabilitation recommendations.

item.title: Microscope
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[kc_row use_container="yes" _id="154195"][kc_column width="12/12" _id="765564"][kc_column_text _id="330754" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`typography`:{`font-size|,p`:`16px`,`line-height|,p`:`30px`}}}}"]

The Program aims to improve the health and quality of life for people. To be a cardiologist in the United States, a three year residency in internal medicine is followed by a three year residency in cardiology. It is possible to specialize further in a sub-specialty.

[/kc_column_text][kc_column_text _id="537191" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`typography`:{`color|,p`:`#000000`,`font-size|,p`:`18px`,`font-weight|,p`:`700`}}}}"]

Heart failure is a clinical syndrome characterised by:

inherit`}}}}"][kc_accordion _id="230479"][kc_accordion_tab title="How is my Medical Services Provider assigned?" _id="112269"][kc_column_text _id="694644"]Your Medical Services Provider is randomly assigned to you when you first enroll at Columbia University. However, you are welcomed to change your health care provider whenever you like simply by informing our front desk staff.[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="How do I make a medical appointment?" _id="458745"][kc_column_text _id="508761"]Use our secure appointment portal, Open CommunicatorOpens in a new window, to make an appointment online[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="What do I need to do to get vaccines?" _id="764345"][kc_column_text _id="23393"]

First, know which vaccine(s) you need. Based on this information, you can either be seen directly at John Jay Hall, 4th Floor or make an appointment for an evaluation.

To make your appointment, schedule it via Open Communicator and select “vaccinations”. Follow the steps listed to identify if you need a nurse or a physician appointment. You can also call (212) 854-7426 to schedule an appointment or come see us at John Jay Hall, 4th Floor to make an appointment in person.

[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="Do I need an appointment for emergency contraception?" _id="856939"][kc_column_text _id="186187"]Visit Medical Services during hours of operation if you need emergency contraception immediately or schedule a same day appointment with a Medical Services provider. Most emergency contraception must be started within 72 hours.[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][/kc_accordion][/kc_column][/kc_row]

inherit`}}}}"][kc_accordion _id="678204"][kc_accordion_tab title="How is my Medical Services Provider assigned?" _id="511876"][kc_column_text _id="184369"]Your Medical Services Provider is randomly assigned to you when you first enroll at Columbia University. However, you are welcomed to change your health care provider whenever you like simply by informing our front desk staff.[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="How do I make a medical appointment?" _id="253567"][kc_column_text _id="59893"]Use our secure appointment portal, Open CommunicatorOpens in a new window, to make an appointment online[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="What do I need to do to get vaccines?" _id="309992"][kc_column_text _id="562683"]

First, know which vaccine(s) you need. Based on this information, you can either be seen directly at John Jay Hall, 4th Floor or make an appointment for an evaluation.

To make your appointment, schedule it via Open Communicator and select “vaccinations”. Follow the steps listed to identify if you need a nurse or a physician appointment. You can also call (212) 854-7426 to schedule an appointment or come see us at John Jay Hall, 4th Floor to make an appointment in person.

[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="Do I need an appointment for emergency contraception?" _id="522138"][kc_column_text _id="481004"]Visit Medical Services during hours of operation if you need emergency contraception immediately or schedule a same day appointment with a Medical Services provider. Most emergency contraception must be started within 72 hours.[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][/kc_accordion][/kc_column][/kc_row]

css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`title-style`:{`color|+.kc_title,.kc_title,.kc_title a.kc_title_link`:`#000000`,`padding|+.kc_title,.kc_title,.kc_title a.kc_title_link`:`inherit inherit 30px inherit`}}}}"][kc_accordion _id="951665"][kc_accordion_tab title="How is my Medical Services Provider assigned?" _id="926435"][kc_column_text _id="309194"]Your Medical Services Provider is randomly assigned to you when you first enroll at Columbia University. However, you are welcomed to change your health care provider whenever you like simply by informing our front desk staff.[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="How do I make a medical appointment?" _id="920268"][kc_column_text _id="261374"]Use our secure appointment portal, Open CommunicatorOpens in a new window, to make an appointment online[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="What do I need to do to get vaccines?" _id="235700"][kc_column_text _id="704744"]

First, know which vaccine(s) you need. Based on this information, you can either be seen directly at John Jay Hall, 4th Floor or make an appointment for an evaluation.

To make your appointment, schedule it via Open Communicator and select “vaccinations”. Follow the steps listed to identify if you need a nurse or a physician appointment. You can also call (212) 854-7426 to schedule an appointment or come see us at John Jay Hall, 4th Floor to make an appointment in person.

[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="Do I need an appointment for emergency contraception?" _id="173702"][kc_column_text _id="48554"]Visit Medical Services during hours of operation if you need emergency contraception immediately or schedule a same day appointment with a Medical Services provider. Most emergency contraception must be started within 72 hours.[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][/kc_accordion][/kc_column][/kc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: The Program aims to improve the health and quality of life for people.

[kc_row use_container="yes" _id="829283"][kc_column width="12/12" _id="328231"][kc_column_text _id="560382" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`typography`:{`font-size|,p`:`16px`,`line-height|,p`:`30px`}}}}"]

We offers a full spectrum of neurological care and rehabilitation recommendations. To be a cardiologist in the United States, a three year residency in internal medicine is followed by a three year residency in cardiology. It is possible to specialize further in a sub-specialty.

[/kc_column_text][kc_column_text _id="760144" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`typography`:{`color|,p`:`#000000`,`font-size|,p`:`18px`,`font-weight|,p`:`700`}}}}"]

Heart failure is a clinical syndrome characterised by:

inherit`}}}}"][kc_accordion _id="65413"][kc_accordion_tab title="How is my Medical Services Provider assigned?" _id="147881"][kc_column_text _id="680415"]Your Medical Services Provider is randomly assigned to you when you first enroll at Columbia University. However, you are welcomed to change your health care provider whenever you like simply by informing our front desk staff.[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="How do I make a medical appointment?" _id="850051"][kc_column_text _id="801831"]Use our secure appointment portal, Open CommunicatorOpens in a new window, to make an appointment online[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="What do I need to do to get vaccines?" _id="900132"][kc_column_text _id="146594"]

First, know which vaccine(s) you need. Based on this information, you can either be seen directly at John Jay Hall, 4th Floor or make an appointment for an evaluation.

To make your appointment, schedule it via Open Communicator and select “vaccinations”. Follow the steps listed to identify if you need a nurse or a physician appointment. You can also call (212) 854-7426 to schedule an appointment or come see us at John Jay Hall, 4th Floor to make an appointment in person.

[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][kc_accordion_tab title="Do I need an appointment for emergency contraception?" _id="826871"][kc_column_text _id="609539"]Visit Medical Services during hours of operation if you need emergency contraception immediately or schedule a same day appointment with a Medical Services provider. Most emergency contraception must be started within 72 hours.[/kc_column_text][/kc_accordion_tab][/kc_accordion][/kc_column][/kc_row]

To be a cardiologist in the United States, a three year residency in internal medicine is followed by a three year residency in cardiology. It is possible to specialize further in a sub-specialty.[/kc_column_text][kc_column_text _id="951404" item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Specialty Services
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[kc_row use_container="yes" _id="120019"][kc_column width="12/12" _id="985097"][kc_column_text _id="320912"] At One Medical, we believe that women’s health and primary care go hand-in-hand, and we offer a comprehensive range of services at our Government Center office. By working with your primary care provider, you can avoid unnecessary specialist visits. Our primary care team can address a variety of women’s health issues, including birth control counseling and prescriptions, pregnancy, sexual health, cancer screening, and aging, while offering the added insight of your complete medical history. And our lab is available on-site for any tests that you might need, without requiring an additional appointment. If your provider feels that you would benefit from a specialist visit, we’re happy to connect you to the right person. [/kc_column_text][/kc_column][/kc_row][kc_row use_container="yes" _id="917731" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`box`:{`margin|`:`30px inherit 50px inherit`}}}}"][kc_column width="50%" _id="604275"][kc_box data="" _id="78767"][/kc_column][kc_column width="50%" _id="720003"][kc_single_image image_size="full" image_effect_option="__empty__" _id="437706" image_source="media_library" image="10222"][/kc_column][/kc_row][kc_row use_container="yes" _id="668784"][kc_column width="12/12" _id="979570"][kc_column_text _id="941559"] Critical Care Our team of experts is prepared to handle the most difficult oncologic emergencies and other complications experienced by cancer patients. Patients can be safely transported to the intensive care unit (ICU) from anywhere in Maryland with our exclusive critical care ambulance system, Maryland ExpressCare. Staffed with specially trained critical care nurses and paramedics, these vehicles operate round the clock and are outfitted with the most modern critical care transport equipment available. Once admitted to the intensive care service, patients benefit from our integrated, interdisciplinary approach to treating cancer.
Some Health Tips Our specialty care providers focus on particular areas of care in which they have extensive training and education
Dental Program Many times cancer patients need special dental care and must be evaluated by physicians specializing in oral care and hygiene. You may be referred to this program by your physician or health care professional for diagnosing and/or treating any oral condition prior to, during, or after your medical care. The dental hygienist can also help you with any oral or dental conditions that may result from your treatment. The Dental Office is located in the North Hospital on 9West, Room 65, and can be reached at 410-328-5940. [/kc_column_text][/kc_column][/kc_row][kc_row use_container="yes" _id="772567" item.excerpt:encoded: Through VA’s specialty care services, you have access to expert knowledge to optimize treatment in unique or complicated courses of care. Our specialty care providers focus on particular areas of care in which they have extensive training and education.

inherit 20px inherit`}}}}"]Mediac Hospital is a 404-bed comprehensive center for pediatric health care. As one of the largest pediatric medical centers in the United States, Mediac’s offers a complete range of health care services for everyone.[/kc_column_text][kc_column_text _id="371932"]We have approximately 25,000 inpatient admissions each year and our 200+ specialized clinical programs schedule 557,000 visits annually. Last year the hospital performed more than 26,500 surgical procedures and 158,700 radiological examinations.[/kc_column_text][/kc_column][kc_column width="50%" _id="827610" Mediac Hospital is a 404-bed comprehensive center for pediatric health care. As one of the largest pediatric medical centers in the United States, Mediac’s offers a complete range of health care services for everyone.

[/kc_column_text][kc_column_text _id="31530" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`typography`:{`font-size|`:`17px`},`box`:{`margin|`:`20px inherit 20px inherit`}}}}"]

We have approximately 25,000 inpatient admissions each year and our 200+ specialized clinical programs schedule 557,000 visits annually. Last year the hospital performed more than 26,500 surgical procedures and 158,700

Health insurance can give you access to private diagnosis and treatment should you fall ill or be injured. It’s designed to complement the NHS rather than replace it and it’s used for planned, not emergency treatment.
With us, depending on the cover you choose, you can receive access to eligible diagnosis and treatment for new conditions in a Bupa-recognised private facility from a Bupa-recognised consultant.

item.title: How Dark Chocolate Can Improve Your Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
What happens when Valentine Fillol-Cordier, a chic Parisian stylist who loves ‘intellectual’ clothes, switches wardrobes with Susie Bubble, a London fashion blogger who champions ‘wayward’ young designers? Get ready for a style swap… Ali Morris pays a visit.On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and pain.
These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish. In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best, every pleasure is to be welcomed and every pain avoided. But in certain circumstances and owing to the claims of duty or the obligations of business it will frequently occur that pleasures have to be repudiated and annoyances accepted. The wise man therefore always holds in these matters to this principle of selection: he rejects pleasures to secure other greater pleasures, or else he endures pains to avoid worse pains.
But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth, the master-builder of human happiness. No one rejects, dislikes, or avoids pleasure itself, because it is pleasure, but because those who do not know how to pursue pleasure rationally encounter consequences that are extremely painful.
Nor again is there anyone who loves or pursues or desires to obtain pain of itself, because it is pain, but because occasionally circumstances occur in which toil and pain can procure him some great pleasure. To take a trivial example, which of us ever undertakes laborious physical exercise, except to obtain some advantage from it? But who has any right to find fault with a man who chooses to enjoy a pleasure that has no annoying consequences, or one who avoids a pain that produces no resultant pleasure?
item.excerpt:encoded: What happens when Valentine Fillol-Cordier, a chic Parisian stylist who loves ‘intellectual’ clothes, switches wardrobes with Susie Bubble..

item.title: 5 Easy Ways to Brighten Up Your Day
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
It happens to the best of us: one minute you're going about your day, all happy and care-free, when suddenly something unexpected happens and your good mood is ruined. Whether it's a back-handed remark from someone or a low mark on a test you had studied for, it's actually quite easy for a perfectly good day to be ruined, if you think about it. Most often you won't feel like eating or talking for a couple of hours and then you'll feel better once you've thought things out. But if your bad mood lasts for more than a day it will start annoying everyone including yourself, and in some cases it'll even rub off on the people around you! Here are a few tips we put together for you to get out of your grumpy mood and start spreading joy around you.
1. Laughter is the best medicine
2. Sweet like chocolate
3. Music sounds better with you
4. Walking on sunshine
5. Splish splash
item.excerpt:encoded: It happens to the best of us: one minute you're going about your day, all happy and care-free, when suddenly something unexpected happens and your good mood is ruined.

item.title: Things You Need to About Family
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
In family relations, the bad schoolwork of your kid can be a cry for help. If a family request for help is ignored, the school may be left with refractory educational problems, and an angry child, which may continue to fail, until someone finally gets the message. In most cases, when children are not in school, some forms of family therapy is warranted.
The goal of family therapy is to change the structures and processes in the family or the environment, in order to ease the strains. Family diagnosis based on the theory of living systems to determine whether the pathology in the family lies as a whole, in one or more individual members or in a suprasystein, such as the economically disadvantaged neighbourhood, city or school with limited resources.
The range of activities available for families is important. Physical Health, mental health, social services, pastoral care, and education all deal with family problems. Marriage counseling just focuses on one aspect of the family and the family services agency have to handle all aspects of the family.
item.excerpt:encoded: In family relations, the bad schoolwork of your kid can be a cry for help. If a family request for help is ignored, the school may be left with refractory educational problems

item.title: Make Sure You Read This Before
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Spring and fall are the best planting times, but it can be all too easy to end up with an empty wallet and a garden filled with struggling, diseased or even dead plants. Thankfully, visits to the nursery can be enjoyable, and successful, as long as you arm yourself with the knowledge to ensure you will come home with beautiful, healthy plants that will increase the curb appeal of your home and garden.
1. Plan before buying. Before you head out to the nursery, it’s important to study the area in your garden where you plan to add your new plant or plants
2. Avoid impulse buys. It can be easy to fall in love with the vibrant blooming plant prominently displayed at the nursery and then buy it without knowing where it will go in the garden or even if it will do well in your climate. This can result in a plant that has a decreased chance of survival.
3. Read the label. Most plants come with their own instruction manual in the form of a plant tag. Types of information that you can find on the tag include the name of the plant, how big it will grow, when it will bloom, what exposure it needs and its water requirements. All of the plant’s information isn’t always listed on its tag, but with the name, you can do a little online research on your own.
4. Know the signs of unhealthy plants. Unfortunately, there can be some unhealthy plants present at the nursery. Here are some warning signs to look out for so you can make sure you won’t take home an ailing plant. 5. Choose buds over blooms. Let’s face it, the flowering plants are what draw our attention as we stroll down the nursery aisles. As tempting as shrubs in full bloom are, it’s wiser to buy a plant that hasn’t flowered yet.
6. Don’t be afraid of small plants. We may be tempted to buy a larger, more mature plant, as opposed to a smaller one, but you may be wasting your money. For example, a 1-gallon perennial or shrub is younger and better able to handle the stresses of planting than a 5-gallon plant. In addition, smaller plants initially grow more quickly than larger ones do. They also cost less money and save you time when planting.
item.excerpt:encoded: Spring and fall are the best planting times, but it can be all too easy to end up with an empty wallet and a garden filled with struggling

item.title: Children's Services in Hampshire - Hampshire County Council
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Our pediatrician is committed to offering care for your child when you need it. Appointments are scheduled from when the office opens until the office closes, and our policy is to make every effort to schedule same-day appointments whenever we can. Walk-ins are are welcomed. We are committed to offering same-day sick visits to every sick child.
Childhood is a time of rapid growth and change
Each visit includes a complete physical examination. At this exam, the health care provider will check the infant or young child’s growth and development, and try to find problems early.
The health care provider will record your child’s height, weight, and other important information. Hearing, vision, and other tests will be part of some visits. Preventive care is important to keep children healthy.
Acute Visits
Because you never know when your child will be sick, we offer same-day sick appointments. Please call early in the day to make acute care same-day sick appointments. Walk-ins are welcomed. We are committed to offering same-day sick visits to every sick child.
Newborn Care
Expecting??? Congratulations! We look forward to providing you and your new bundle of joy with comprehensive and compassionate care. Many first-time parents are not sure what to expect when the baby arrives. We invite all expecting parents to schedule a free prenatal visit to meet Dr. Dotson and staff.
Developmental Screening
Developmental screening provides parents and professionals with information on whether a child's development is similar to other children of the same age. Screening involves the use of a standardized screening tool.
School and Sport Physicals
The sports physical exam is known as a pre-participation physical examination (PPE). The exam helps determine whether it's safe for your child to participate in a particular sport. Most sports programs require children and teens to have a sports physical before they can start a new sport or begin a new competitive season.
item.excerpt:encoded: Our pediatrician is committed to offering care for your child when you need it.

item.title: Glucosamine Sulfate
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Glucosamine exists naturally in the body and is a building block for healthy cartilage and connective tissue. Recent studies have validated its relationship to enhanced mobility. It can protect cartilage and is also beneficial for athletes experiencing connective tissue stress. Natural Factors Glucosamine Sulfate is tested for potency and heavy metals in order to meet our high standards. All Natural Factors products are manufactured accordance with the Government of Canada's Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), among the highest standards. Suggested Use 1 capsule, 2 - 3 times per day or as directed by a health professional. Other Ingredients Rice powder, gelatin capsule (gelatin, purified water), magnesium stearate (vegetable grade). Contains crabs, prawns, shrimp and crayfish. Contains no artificial preservatives, color or sweeteners; no corn, dairy, soy wheat or yeast. Warnings Keep out of reach of children. Sealed for your protection. Do not use if seal on cap is broken. For freshness store in a cool, dry place.
item.excerpt:encoded: Glucosamine exists naturally in the body and is a building block for healthy cartilage and connective tissue. Recent studies have validated its relationship to enhanced mobility. It can protect cartilage and is also beneficial for athletes experiencing connective tissue stress.

1800 - 333 555 78
[/kc_column_text][kc_column_text _id="282035" css_custom="{`kc-css`:{`any`:{`typography`:{`font-size|,p`:`16px`,`line-height|,p`:`30px`}}}}"]
The key to success is to keep your head above the water, never give up. The first of the month is coming, we have to get money, we have no choice. Learning is cool, but knowing is better, and I know the key to success.
[/kc_column_text][/kc_column][kc_column width="16.66%" responsive="eyIxIjp7InNjcmVlbiI6IihtYXgtd2lkdGg6IDQ3OXB4KSIsInJhbmdlIjoiNzY4cHh8OTk5cHgiLCJvZmZzZXQiOiIwIiwiY29sdW1ucyI6IjAiLCJpbXBvcnRhbnQiOiIiLCJkaXNwbGF5IjoiIn19" _id="683959"][/kc_column][/kc_row]

item.title: 8 Ways to Get Through the Day When You're Depressed
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Our pediatrician is committed to offering care for your child when you need it. Appointments are scheduled from when the office opens until the office closes, and our policy is to make every effort to schedule same-day appointments whenever we can. Walk-ins are are welcomed. We are committed to offering same-day sick visits to every sick child.
Childhood is a time of rapid growth and change
Each visit includes a complete physical examination. At this exam, the health care provider will check the infant or young child’s growth and development, and try to find problems early.
The health care provider will record your child’s height, weight, and other important information. Hearing, vision, and other tests will be part of some visits. Preventive care is important to keep children healthy.
Acute Visits
Because you never know when your child will be sick, we offer same-day sick appointments. Please call early in the day to make acute care same-day sick appointments. Walk-ins are welcomed. We are committed to offering same-day sick visits to every sick child.
Newborn Care
Expecting??? Congratulations! We look forward to providing you and your new bundle of joy with comprehensive and compassionate care. Many first-time parents are not sure what to expect when the baby arrives. We invite all expecting parents to schedule a free prenatal visit to meet Dr. Dotson and staff.
Developmental Screening
Developmental screening provides parents and professionals with information on whether a child's development is similar to other children of the same age. Screening involves the use of a standardized screening tool.
School and Sport Physicals
The sports physical exam is known as a pre-participation physical examination (PPE). The exam helps determine whether it's safe for your child to participate in a particular sport. Most sports programs require children and teens to have a sports physical before they can start a new sport or begin a new competitive season.

item.title: Now Foods, Methyl B-12, 1,000 mcg, 100 Lozenges
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Vitamin B-12 is necessary for the production of energy from fats and proteins and is well known for its critical role in DNA synthesis, as well as in homocysteine metabolism. Methylcobalamin is the co-enzyme form of Vitamin B-12 that has been found to be especially critical in the maintenance of a healthy nervous system. Dietary sources are almost exclusively of animal origin (meat and dairy) and supplementation with B-12 may be especially important for strict vegetarians. Now methyl B-12 is vegetarian/vegan (non-animal derived). Suggested Use Take 1 lozenge 1 to 2 times daily. Chew lozenge or hold in mouth until dissolved and swallow. Other Ingredients Fructose, sorbitol, cellulose, stearic acid (vegetable source), citric acid, natural flavors and magnesium stearate (vegetable source). Not manufactured with wheat, gluten, soy, milk, egg, fish, shellfish or tree nut ingredients. Produced in a GMP facility that processes other ingredients containing these allergens. Natural color variation may occur in this product. Warnings Do not eat freshness packet. Keep in bottle. Store in a cool, dry place after opening. For adults only. Consult physician if pregnant/nursing, taking medication, or have a medical condition. Keep out of reach of children.
item.excerpt:encoded: Vitamin B-12 is necessary for the production of energy from fats and proteins and is well known for its critical role in DNA synthesis, as well as in homocysteine metabolism.

item.title: MSM Methyl sulfonyl methane
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Jarrow Formulas MSM is an organic source of bioavailable sulfur. Sulfur is an antioxidant mineral found in major structural tissues of the body such as cartilage. The sulfur from MSM is used to produce glycosaminoglycans (or mucopolysaccharides) present in proteoglycans such as chondroitin sulfate, dermatan sulfate, and hyaluronic acid. These sulfur containing glycosaminoglycans are found in high concentrations in connective tissues, including joint cartilage, skin and collagen. Suggested Use Take 1 capsule 1 to 3 times per day or as directed by your qualified healthcare professional. For best results, use with Jarrow Formulas JarroSil, the biologically Activated Silicon. Other Ingredients Magnesium stearate (vegetable source). Capsule consists of gelatin. No wheat, no gluten, no soybeans, no dairy, no egg, no fish/shellfish, no peanuts/tree nuts. Warnings Note: If you have a medical condition, are pregnant, lactating, or trying to conceive, under the age of 18, or taking medications, consult your healthcare professional before using this product. Keep out of the reach of children.
item.excerpt:encoded: Jarrow Formulas MSM is an organic source of bioavailable sulfur. Sulfur is an antioxidant mineral found in major structural tissues of the body such as cartilage.

item.title: Jarrow Formulas Methyl Folate
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Methyl Folate ((6S)-5-methyltetrahydrofolic acid or (6S)-5-MTHF) is the most biologically active form of folic acid. Quatrefolic is the 4th generation development in folate delivery. With certain inherited errors in metabolism and under a variety of physiologic stresses, the transformation of folic acid into the active form of folate either does not properly take place or is inadequate. Unlike folic acid, this form of folate can cross the blood-brain barrier. Methyl Folate is needed to support cardiovascular and neurologic health and proper cell division. Health Claim: Healthful diets with adequate folic acid may reduce a woman's risk of having a child with certain brain or spinal cord defects. Suggested Use Take 1 capsule per day with food or as directed by your qualified healthcare professional. Other Ingredients Cellulose and magnesium stearate (vegetable source). Capsule consists of gelatin. No wheat, not gluten, no soybeans, no dairy, no egg, no fish/shellfish, no peanuts/tree nuts. Warnings Note: The elderly should frequently check B12 status when taking folic acid as folic acid may mask pernicious anemia. If you have a medical condition, are pregnant, lactating, trying to conceive, under the age of 18, or taking medications (especially antiepileptic and chemotherapy medications), consult your healthcare professional before using this product. Keep out of the reach of children.
item.excerpt:encoded: Methyl Folate ((6S)-5-methyltetrahydrofolic acid or (6S)-5-MTHF) is the most biologically active form of folic acid. Quatrefolic is the 4th generation development in folate delivery.

item.title: Methylcobalamin (Methyl B-12)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Methylcobalamin (Methyl B-12) is better absorbed and retained than other forms of B12 (e.g., cyanocobalamin).* Methyl B-12 supports nerve tissue and brain cells, promotes better sleep and recycles (via methylation) homocysteine, an oxidizing metabolite, back into the amino acid methionine.* Also, vegetarians/vegans often require B12 supplementation.*
Suggested Usage Dissolve in mouth or chew 1 lozenge per day or as directed by your qualified healthcare professional.
NOTE: If you have a medical condition, are pregnant, lactating, trying to conceive, under the age of 18, or taking medications, consult your healthcare professional before using this product.
Other Ingredients Xylitol, cellulose, stearic acid (vegetable source), natural lemon flavor, magnesium stearate (vegetable source), citric acid and silicon dioxide.
No wheat, no gluten, no soybeans, no dairy, no egg, no fish/shellfish, no peanuts/tree nuts.
item.excerpt:encoded: Methylcobalamin (Methyl B-12) is better absorbed and retained than other forms of B12 (e.g., cyanocobalamin). Methyl B-12 supports nerve tissue and brain cells, promotes better sleep and recycles (via methylation) homocysteine, an oxidizing metabolite, back into the amino acid methionine.

item.title: TMG 500 mg - Hypoallergenic
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Originally formulated for physicians use with higher potencies than Kirkman’s other TMG products. Supports the methylation pathway and serotonin levels. Hypoallergenic. Gluten and casein free. Capsules are plant based. Ultra Tested®.
Trimethylglycine (TMG) is a more active “methyl donor” than DMG because it has an additional methyl group in its chemical structure. It is used to convert homocysteine to methionine.
TMG is found in a variety of plant and animal sources. Kirkman’s TMG derives from beets.
Methyl donors can help in the production of several brain chemicals. Some of the methione from TMG is converted into SAMe (S-adenosylmethionine), which can help maintain healthy serotonin levels in the body that may support mood, energy, concentration and a feeling of well-being.
Folic acid intake and levels in the body must be adequate for TMG to work biochemically. In some individuals, the use of natural folinic acid may be more beneficial than folic acid because folinic acid already has attached four hydrogen atoms and one methyl group, thereby shortcutting the complicated biochemical processes that assist purine and nucleotide synthesis. These processes are very important in cell perception and response.
item.excerpt:encoded: Originally formulated for physicians use with higher potencies than Kirkman’s other TMG products. Supports the methylation pathway and serotonin levels. Hypoallergenic. Gluten and casein free. Capsules are plant based. Ultra Tested®.

item.title: Lacinia eget consectetur
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth, the master-builder of human happiness. No one rejects, dislikes, or avoids pleasure itself, because it is pleasure, but because those who do not know how to pursue pleasure rationally encounter consequences that are extremely painful.
On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and pain. These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish.
In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best, every pleasure is to be welcomed and every pain avoided. But in certain circumstances and owing to the claims of duty or the obligations of business it will frequently occur that pleasures have to be repudiated and annoyances accepted. The wise man therefore always holds in these matters to this principle of selection: he rejects pleasures to secure other greater pleasures, or else he endures pains to avoid worse pains.
item.excerpt:encoded: But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth

item.title: Country Life Maxi-Hair 90 Tablets
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Maxi-Hair has been adored by loyal consumers for more than 20 years, and is one of Country Life's best-sellers. This product, which is formulated with B vitamins, biotin and MSM, brings life back to your hair, skin and nails. Also available in capsules with higher biotin potency in Maxi-Hair Plus. Suggested Use Adults take two (2) tablets daily. For best utilization, take with food. Do not exceed recommended dose. As a reminder, discuss the supplements and medications that you take with your health care providers. Other Ingredients Cellulose, stearic acid, oligosaccharides (chicory root), magnesium stearate, cellulose & glycerin coating, silica, calcium silicate, natural vanilla flavor, maltodextrin, vegetable glaze.
item.excerpt:encoded: Maxi-Hair has been adored by loyal consumers for more than 20 years, and is one of Country Life's best-sellers. This product, which is formulated with B vitamins, biotin and MSM, brings life back to your hair, skin and nails.

item.title: Methyl Salicylate Wintergreen
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Methyl Salicylate (aka Wintergreen) is a common ingredient in sports balms and heat rubs - it is the chemical that provides the warming sensation and aroma. This bottle contains 500ml of pure Methyl Salicylate and can be used in sports warm-up or massage and for soothing sore or tired muscles.
Do not apply neat Methyl Salicylate directly to the skin. It must be diluted at least 4-to-1 before use.
item.excerpt:encoded: Methyl Salicylate (aka Wintergreen) is a common ingredient in sports balms and heat rubs - it is the chemical that provides the warming sensation and aroma.

item.title: Gold Cross Methyl Salicylate Liniment APF
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Methyl Salicylate Liniment is applied to the skin to offer relief from muscle aches and pains.
Relieves muscle aches and pains.
Ingredients - Methyl Salicylate 25ml/100ml
- Also contains Peanut (Arachis) oil.
Directions Apply to the skin of affected area and massage well into the skin.
item.excerpt:encoded: Methyl Salicylate Liniment is applied to the skin to offer relief from muscle aches and pains.

item.title: What is health promotion?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
“When prevention works, nothing happens.”
Health promotion is focused on broad, community-level interventions that help shape the environmental contexts in which people live, learn, love, and work. Health promotion includes policy change, advocacy, adjusting built environments, and coalition building. Much of the work of health promotion happens “behind the scenes” and involves collecting and analyzing data, setting priorities for interventions, assessing and evaluating the progress of programs and services, meeting with key stakeholders and decision-makers, advocating for policies or structural changes that will help improve the health of the population, and implementing health-enhancing initiatives.
Some of the specific health promotion work that Alice! does includes: conducting assessments of student health attitudes and behaviors; analyzing data to determine where our resources can best be utilized to prevent illness and improve student health and learning; meeting with groups of students and the faculty and staff that work with them to determine how to address the health issues most affecting their academic performance; and advocating for policy and programmatic changes that enhance the health of the campus environment.
item.excerpt:encoded: Health promotion is focused on broad, community-level interventions that help shape the environmental contexts in which people live, learn, love, and work.

item.title: What to expect at your office visit with the acupuncturist?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Typically an acupuncturist will begin by taking a complete history by asking numerous questions about your primary complaint as well as more general health issues. An acupuncturist physical exam may resemble a more conventional exam, including vital signs like weight, temperature and blood pressure.
It is also likely to include a more detailed examination and analysis of the pulse and tongue as well as abdominal palpation and facial diagnosis.
When the acupuncturist has arrived a working diagnosis, he or she will place you in a comfortable position to insert needles. you may be seated although it is more common to lie down.
Ten to 20 needles may be inserted although more or less is not uncommon. Once you are comfortable, you will relax in the treatment room for 15 to 20 minutes checking on you periodically to ensure that you are still comfortable.
item.excerpt:encoded: Typically an acupuncturist will begin by taking a complete history by asking numerous questions about your primary complaint as well as more general health issues.

item.title: Emergency Anaesthetic Team
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
At large events supported by the Event Medicine Company (EMC) a designated team of pre-hospital care practitioners is available to deliver advanced airway interventions up to and including pre-hospital emergency anaesthesia (PHEA,) anywhere it may be required on site or in the immediate surrounding area.
The Emergency Anaesthetic Team consists of 2 clinical staff, a doctor and a nurse, paramedic or operating department practitioner, all of whom are trained and experienced in the provision of PHEA. The team is available for deployment when requested by anEMC asset on scene or at the request of the local statutory ambulance service.
At Farnborough International Airshow the Emergency Anaesthetic Team members are integrated with the Casualty Clearing Team but can be utilised independently should the need arise.

item.title: How to Schedule an Appointment Online.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
All of our students have a designated health care provider, also called a Primary Care Provider (PCP), who works within a team of nurses and support staff (practice group) and are here to help them. Open Communicator is the secure online portal for students to access Medical Services and are automatically eligible to access Open CommunicatorOpens in a new window after paying the Columbia Health Fee and activating their Columbia UNI.
Note: Some students at affiliated institutions will have to be entered manually into the system before they are able to access Open Communicator. If you feel you are eligible, but are having difficulty accessing the secure site, please call Medical Services for assistance.
When logged into Open Communicator, students are able to schedule, reschedule or cancel appointments, complete a pre-visit questionnaire, change their PCP, print out immunization records, send a secure message to a provider or nurse, or request a prescription refill. New features are being added all the time, and students are encouraged to become familiar with this site and to check back frequently.

item.title: National Event Support
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
From mud runs to marathons, commercial filming to private staffing, we can take medical planning and staffing off your plate and devour it up.
Not sure how to get your permit approved because of safety considerations? We’ve brought together disparate agencies and stakeholders to create successful permit applications.
Don’t know how to write an operational plan? We have helped others figure it out how to cover 30,000 spectators and attendees with excellent medical care.
If you need it done efficiently and effectively, just ask and we will get down to business with a smile on our face.

item.title: Scheduling an Appointment
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Opens in a new window appointments are strongly encouraged so that Medical Services staff may be sensitive to any time constraints. It is also helpful if you provide basic information about the reason for your intended visit (e.g., stomach pains, headache, travel assessment, pregnancy screening, prescription refill). We will work with you to arrange an appointment with your regular provider.
Everyone is assigned a Medical Services provider or PCP. The assignment process is random and is done by computer. You can change your provider at any time. If you know your PCP, or if you wish to change your provider, please let the person scheduling your appointment know.

item.title: How do I get a prescription refilled
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Getting a prescription refilled depends on whether you’ve already been seen here and the type of medication you need. If you are a new patient, first make an appointment with Medical Services for an evaluation. Returning patients can refill prescriptions by calling (212) 854-7426 or go online and send your health care provider a secured message with your request.
Some prescriptions require visits with your Medical Services provider for renewal—make an appointment ahead of time to ensure you don’t run out of medications.
item.excerpt:encoded: Getting a prescription refilled depends on whether you’ve already been seen here and the type of medication you need.
